name: N-(4-decylphenyl)-4-methylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2315
Reason: 4-decylphenyl and methylbenzamide functionalities contribute to the melting point. The decylphenyl group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at +20 °C. The methylbenzamide moiety introduces a hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at +10 °C. The presence of these functionalities raises the melting point.
